importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the news release, indicating when the incident was reported and when the public learned of Doug Martin's death.
The date of Doug Martin’s draft selection in the NFL, highlighting a pivotal moment in his professional career.
The year Martin had a standout rushing season, emphasizing a peak performance in his career.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The timeframe during which Martin was arrested and died—early Saturday, October 5, 2025—suggests a sudden and tragic event that occurred within a short window, raising public concern about law enforcement practices and use of force.

keyTakeAways: Former NFL running back Doug Martin died after a brief struggle with police during a detention for a suspected break-in in Oakland.
Martin, a 36-year-old former All-Pro with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, was transported to a hospital and died shortly after being taken into custody.
A cause of death has not been officially released, and an autopsy is pending.
Martin was selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL Draft and finished his career with 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns.
He was named first-team All-Pro and selected to the Pro Bowl in both 2012 and 2015.
Martin was recognized as one of the top 50 players in Tampa Bay Buccaneers history during the franchise’s 50th anniversary.
The Oakland Police Department reported a 'brief struggle' during the arrest; no further details were released.
The Oakland Mayor, Barbara Lee, and the Tampa Bay Buccaneers expressed condolences, highlighting Martin’s legacy and impact.
The incident has sparked public concern about police interactions with individuals, especially those with criminal or legal histories, and raised questions about de-escalation and use of force.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Former NFL running back Doug Martin, known for his outstanding performance with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died after a brief struggle with Oakland police officers during a detention related to a suspected break-in at a home in Oakland. He was 36 and had a career marked by 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns. Though the exact cause of death has not been released, an autopsy is pending. The incident has raised public concern about police use of force and interactions with individuals during detentions. The Oakland Police Department, Mayor Barbara Lee, and the Buccaneers all issued statements expressing condolences, underscoring Martin’s legacy and the broader societal implications of the event.
title: Former NFL Player Doug Martin Dies After Police Detention During Break-In Investigation
